page.title: 14SERLBY HALL
page.content: Serlby Hall is an elegant red brick house situated in a most attractive, well wooded park about 2 miles north of Blyth, just off the A614. The house was built in 1740 for John Monkton, the first Viscount Galway, a descendant of an ancient family which, prior to that date, had occupied various seats in the nearby county of Yorkshire for over five hundred years. Many of the contents of Serlby are connected with earlier members of the family.The original home of the family was at Monckton, near York.One of the interesting features of the contents of Serlby is the fine collection of English and continental porcelains to be seen around the house. The new owner of the Hall is Major Berry who it is thought no longer opens the house to the public.
